channel.title: Item Recolor Gen: v5 [Java Written + .Bat] ~ 100% Works & UNIQUE! (60+ Colors)
channel.description:
[size=17pt]POST[/size][size=30pt] :eek:[/size] [hr][b][size=18pt]Item Recolor Gen: v5[/size][/b] [size=8pt]Created by: 75% Steven (For writing program) 25% Roger (For idea and data gathering)[/size][hr]
[i]Download here: http://files.filefront.com/Item+Recolor+Gen+v4+v5rar/;12353693;/fileinfo.html[/i] Pictures are at the bottom.
[b]What does this do?[/b]
This is a program that will help you recolor your items. I know, recoloring items is stupid, but this is a great helpful program that was never before seen. Except the other versions which were later deleted due to being a .bat file. Well this is improved and now contains both a Java based and a .Bat based. Those who prefer either one can use them at ease.
[b]How do I use this?[/b]
For the .bat file, you would type in the color name. Here is the full list of colors you can choose from and get the required ID.
[code] white gold black lightyellow darkblack darkyellow yellow pink darkbrown darkpink lightpink darkred adamant skin red gray lightgray darkgray steel mud peach rune lightorange lightgreen darkgreen green lightteal iron limegreen blue pukegreen forestgreen lightblue mithril lightskyblue darkgold teal purple lightpurple lightmagenta magenta skyblue darkpurple darkmagenta bronze dragon granite gilded bloodred lava indigo babyblue babypink slategray sunyellow dodgerblue armygreen neongreen cream fuchsia turquoise [/code]
For the java version, in the box provided, select through the list and you will see the text change.
[center] [b][size=12pt]Pictures Below![/size][/b]
[img]http://img514.imageshack.us/img514/2716/pic1ap9.png[/img]
[img]http://img78.imageshack.us/img78/8307/pic2ln9.png[/img]
[img]http://img33.picoodle.com/data/img33/3/9/6/f_2m_f02df2e.png[/img]
[img]http://img34.picoodle.com/data/img34/3/9/7/f_2m_18c45d9.png[/img] [/center]
[b]Download link again:[/b][size=11pt] http://files.filefront.com/Item+Recolor+Gen+v4+v5rar/;12353693;/fileinfo.html[/size] [hr]

item.title: Item Recolor Gen: v5 [Java Written + .Bat] ~ 100% Works & UNIQUE! (60+ Colors)
item.dc:creator: @x_blitz_x x blitz x
item.description:
@x_blitz_x wrote:

satesql:

Can this go in reverse, say type the number in than it finds the color?

Nope, i could re-program it like that. But it would only find the color nearest the one you typed in. Also, it would only find colors we already know.

SkillersDream:

Nice Job Man, Would Rep You If You Didn’t Have 200rep

Haha, That’s a bitch.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Rog3r Rog3r
item.description:
@Rog3r wrote:

Equilibrium:

You could have added mine as well, problem is mine don’t give you the code ID.

Well that’s where ours comes in handy huh?

jmood128:

ok… right… i like it but… i won’t use it i think i would just recolor on my own with out that

It’s not like you need this tool to recolor, but it just tells you the ID of the colors which is a bit easier then remembering.

item.title: Item Recolor Gen: v5 [Java Written + .Bat] ~ 100% Works & UNIQUE! (60+ Colors)
item.dc:creator: @x_blitz_x x blitz x
item.description:
@x_blitz_x wrote:

hasumon:

What’s the point in that ‘Get another color’ part? Should just say like ‘Press any key to return to the color menu’ or something like that. If they don’t want to, there’s always a x button… but w-e. No point really to this also. A simple list would be better , faster, and more convenient :\

Mine is a list. It’s a drop down list so you can select a diffrent color.

As you choose a diffrent color the color ID will change.

Read full topic
